about.creativity_description: I believe the functioning of a page is as important as its aesthetics. Details and interactivity are my 2 pillars, which are more effective with the active kind of users who enjoy discovering microexperiences generated by movement.
about.logic_description: Architect with a strong base in system design and diagramming, eager to learn. Currently studying computer engineering along with courses to expand my knowledge in the world of programming.

experience.description: Indie videogame studio that has developed “Surviving the Humans”, a classic 2D point-and-click adventure. Currently involved in the development of a new 3D adventure game, I am part of the team working on this project.

roles.name: Environmental Designer
roles.description: I created the preliminary architecture design in Blender and material design in Quixel Mixer to explore the style that the game will have.

roles.name: Game Designer
roles.description: Along with the team, I developed the structure and pillars of the game based on the player's experience, the variables that define it, gameplay concepts and replayability.

roles.name: Basic BP Developer
roles.description: Using basic blueprint development (block programming in Unreal Engine), I designed mechanics on a prototyping level that were adapted to the culture on which the game is based, iterating on gameplay.

courses.name: #YoProgramo
courses.description: The first phase of the programming and computational thinking training program, offered by the government of Argentina. It covers the fundamentals of programming through the use of Gobstones, Java, and Ruby.

courses.name: #SeProgramar
courses.description: The second phase of the programming and computational thinking training program, offered by the government of Argentina. It covers different tools related to agile methodologies such as Scrum, and develops a full-stack profile through the creation of a portfolio. To carry out the project, participants deepen their knowledge in HTML and CSS, Angular, Java, MySQL, and Springboot.

courses.name: Diplomatura en Professional Front End Developer
courses.description: The training program covers the development of flexible and adaptable websites that can adjust to any screen size, use of JQuery libraries to add interactivity to websites without having to write all the code from scratch and fundamental knowledge of Javascript. The training emphasizes the use of semantic elements, optimized design techniques in website layout, as well as HTML5 and CSS3 usage.

courses.name: Responsive Web Design
courses.description: Basics of HTML and CSS through the development of 19 web pages and a personal portfolio, including modern techniques such as CSS variables and best practices for accessibility. Master responsive design with Flexbox and CSS Grid.

courses.name: Fundamentals
courses.description: Functions, creating variables, control code flow. This course uses JavaScript, but the concepts can be applied to any coding language.

courses.name: Fundamentals II
courses.description: Building on the knowledge you gained in Fundamentals; learn how to manipulate string and arrays, use alternative approaches to similar problems and create your own functions.

courses.name: Animations
courses.description: Create, manipulate, and animate shapes. This course uses the D3 library, Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG), and JavaScript.

courses.name: Animations II
courses.description: Create interactive, manipulatable animations. Use of Arrow functions.

courses.name: Array Methods
courses.description: Different ways to search arrays, combine elements, and transform elements using arrow functions.

courses.name: Automation
courses.description: Automate tasks using Apps Script, a Google product powered by JavaScript.

courses.name: Debugging Code
courses.description: Spot errors of different types and use coding tools such as try catch statements and the console for debugging.

courses.name: Intro to Webpages
courses.description: HTML, CSS, and how JavaScript can interact with them.

courses.name: 30 Days of Code
courses.description: Basic problem solving challenges, such as Conditional Statements, Class vs. Instante, Data Types, etc.. Earned 2 stars having solved the challenges that correspond to days 0-6.

courses.name: 10 Days of JS
courses.description: Basic problem solving challenges, such as Conditional Statements, Loops, Arrays, etc. Earned 3 stars having solved the challenges that correspond to days 0-3.

courses.name: Desarrollador Generalista de Unreal Engine 5
courses.description: Focuses on the stages of developing a level, including blockout, references, prototyping, asset libraries, composition, geometry, effects, and lighting. The course concludes with a final workshop in which students will apply all of the skills they have acquired to develop a game from start to finish, including design, prototyping, development, testing, and construction. The areas covered include UE5 interface and configuration, assets, levels, sub-levels, and actors, as well as the creation of a game and how to combine components, variables, and programming basic movements via Blueprints. Finally, physics, special effects, sound, music, and generating cinematics with Sequencer.

hard.name: Full-Stack Developer
hard.description: As stated in the initial description, I believe there is a balance between my logical and creative abilities that fits the full-stack profile. I have a strong ability to work independently once a clear path is determined, and I have also completed projects as part of a team.

hard.name: Software knowledge
hard.description: Good proficiency in Excel programming, graphs and data analysis in Power BI.

hard.name: Agile methodologies
hard.description: The second stage of the course focuses on the SCRUM methodology through reading and development of Excel files to set up sprints, I am familiar with Codecks as well.

hard.name: UI design
hard.description: Basic knowledge of Photoshop and intermediate skills in video editing tools, exemplified in the AI project in the 'Projects' section. Regarding 3D modeling, I have experience in Blender and Rhinoceros, having used the latter during my architecture degree to model different types of structures and generate architectural documentation.

hard.name: Database management
hard.description: Intermediate level of data handling in MySQL and graphical representation in Tableau, with experience using MySQL for academic studies and during the development of my current portfolio.

hard.name: Multilingual
hard.description: High level of proficiency in English, intermediate proficiency in French, and basic proficiency in Russian. I strive to improve my language skills on a daily basis. I am particularly interested in the possibility of working for a foreign company.

soft.name: Willingness to learn
soft.description: One of the main characteristics that drive me to develop projects is my ambition and perfectionism. I dedicate most of my free time to reinterpreting web pages based on exercises found on the internet or creating my own exercises. I am very interested in learning about programming in general and I am open to all types of knowledge and perfecting specific tools.

soft.name: Teamwork
soft.description: As someone who values collaboration and teamwork, I understand the importance of taking initiative, being accountable, and supporting others. Even though I may not hold a formal leadership position, I still strive to make a positive impact by actively listening, effectively communicating, and helping my team stay motivated and focused.

soft.name: Creativity
soft.description: I am interested in thinking about how things can relate to each other. I strive to strike a balance between creativity and logic, so that one doesn't compromise the other. While I value my own perspective, I am always open to considering new ideas and perspectives.

soft.name: Organization
soft.description: I tend to make lists for all the activities I perform and organize them in a way that is accessible to anyone who reviews them. This type of organization is helpful since task subdivision greatly facilitates multitasking, a strategy that I am familiar with. Additionally, attention to detail is a positive quality, although at times it can lead to excessively meticulous work.

soft.name: Problem solving
soft.description: When approaching problem-solving, I believe it is essential to involve as many perspectives as possible, not only to arrive at the most optimal solution, but also to strengthen relationships with colleagues.

soft.name: Critical thinking
soft.description: When facing a challenge, I focus on understanding the parts of the system. After finishing specific tasks, I tend to analyze the project as a whole to evaluate the usefulness and effectiveness of each part.  trying to ensure that the polishing of small details makes sense in relation to the overall work.

projects.title: BeautyMorphosy
projects.description: BeautyMorphosy is the first project I developed in HTML and CSS in July of last year. I am very interested in things that change shape and evolve, which is why in several projects my content is oriented towards these insects and the cataloging of species. One of the biggest challenges was developing a paint program without JS, only using HTML and CSS selectors.

projects.title: freeCodeCamp Album
projects.description: The objective of this project is to compare the outcome of the original exercise provided by fCC (fCC style) and my personal approach based on this original exercise (My Style).

subprojects.name: Cat Photo App
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course  involves learning the most common HTML tags by building a cat photo app.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is the interaction with elements on hover, including the revealing of blurry images and a character walking between boxes.

subprojects.name: Cafe Menu
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves learning CSS by designing a menu page for a cafe webpage.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is the use of a dotted line to indicate prices and some aesthetic changes to the elements.

subprojects.name: Markers
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a set of colored markers by exploring different ways to set color values and how to pair colors with each other.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is using the element to create a dynamic marker sales page. When hovering over marker sets, colors to be purchased are exemplified with a drawing on the left side.

subprojects.name: Registration Form
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves learning HTML forms by building a signup page, how to control what types of data people can type into a form, and some new CSS tools for styling a page.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is reorganizing the form to fit on the screen and be in a box format.

subprojects.name: Survey Form
subprojects.fcc_style_description: This is one of the required projects to earn the certification, meaning the layout of the project is entirely up to the developer. The course involves building a survey form to collect data from users.
subprojects.my_style_description: For this first independently designed project, I created a fictional form with a dark theme and for the first time, incorporated a GIPH to make the page more dynamic.

subprojects.name: Abstract Gallery
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves using CSS and the Box Model to create Rothko-style rectangular art pieces.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is adopting the individual element to create an art gallery. To complete the project, I researched three of the major exponents of Abstract Art. When hovering over each painting, interesting facts about the artists can be read.

subprojects.name: Cat Gallery
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves using Flexbox to build a responsive photo gallery webpage.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is the reinterpretation of the original gallery in its mutant form. Clicking on the paintings reveals transmuted feline characters with descriptions.

subprojects.name: Nutrition Label
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves using typography to build a nutrition label webpage and learning how to style text, adjust line height, and position it using CSS.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is using the nutrition label to create a candy application. The user can interactively read the information of each type of lollipop by hovering over the cards, which correspond graphically to the selected element.

subprojects.name: Quiz
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a quiz webpage learning accessibility tools such as keyboard shortcuts, ARIA attributes, and design best practices.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is an aesthetic retouch with a technological focus without changing the information, in order to evaluate the adjustments. I am interested in attempting to reflect the content's aesthetic character on the design of the page.

subprojects.name: Tribute Page
subprojects.fcc_style_description: This is one of the required projects to earn the certification, meaning the layout of the project is entirely up to the developer. The original course involves building a tribute page for a subject that can be either fictional or real.
subprojects.my_style_description: For my second independent project, I designed a tribute page for a fictional character based on a character from my own book. I used color and image definition as resources to highlight the most important part of the image, which corresponds to the character's spine.

subprojects.name: Balance Sheet
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a balance sheet using pseudo selectors, how to change the style of an element hovering over it with a mouse, and triggering other events on the webpage.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is the design contribution and interaction with the form through arrows that rotate in response to user clicks.

subprojects.name: Piano
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves coding a piano, learning more about media queries and pseudo selectors.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is the design of a functional piano with which the user can interact using the keyboard or mouse. I was interested in designing a children's piano, so I modified the sounds of an original piano to have the effect of a music box.

subprojects.name: Documentation Page
subprojects.fcc_style_description: This is one of the required projects to earn the certification, meaning the layout of the project is entirely up to the developer. The original course involves building a technical documentation page to serve as instruction or reference for a topic.
subprojects.my_style_description: The third independent project, 'Hellbox' is an application for learning how to use Flexbox. Based on the information from W3Schools, I designed exercises for the user to learn how to use Flexbox rules, accompanied by characters who have come out of hell. Each exercise is based on a box with gems, whose position is affected by the value entered by the user in each rule, which must be interpreted according to the character's instructions.

subprojects.name: City Skyline
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a city skyline configuring CSS variables that can be reused.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is taking the static design of the city to create an interactive stage with animals. The sun can be dragged across the screen, and depending on its position, the animals react differently. When it becomes night, a bat appears and the user can play by turning off the lights of the buildings.

subprojects.name: Magazine
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a magazine article with CSS Grid, including concepts like grid rows and grid columns.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is to redesign the page with an old newspaper concept and implement the redirection to contact through social media buttons.

subprojects.name: Product Landing
subprojects.fcc_style_description: This is one of the required projects to earn the certification, meaning the layout of the project is entirely up to the developer. The original course involves building a product landing page to market a product of the developer's choice.
subprojects.my_style_description: For the fourth independent project, “ButterPedya”, I designed a webpage for purchasing caterpillars. I included the silhouette of each of the 3 researched species in their different stages, which are revealed when the user hovers over them with the mouse. Additionally, I included videos extracted from YouTube, and an interactive diagram with additional information about the process of caterpillar evolution.

subprojects.name: Ferris Wheel
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a Ferris wheel using CSS to animate elements, transform them, and adjust their speed.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is creating a quiz application using the original element of a ferris wheel. The user has to collect keys by answering the questions correctly in order to unlock chests and release all the creatures from the cards. The logic of questions and answers is developed with JS, as well as the key counting and the shuffling of questions and answers in each interaction.

subprojects.name: Penguin
subprojects.fcc_style_description: The original course involves building a penguin using CSS transforms to position and resize the parts of it, create a background, and animate the character.
subprojects.my_style_description: The personal addition to the project is the development of an application based on the original character, a penguin, where the focus is on animations. The user must build objects by clicking on the elements that make up each of the objects of the stations - ice, snow, and wood - to create a castle, a snowman, and a deer, respectively. Once the user finishes building an element, its particular animation is activated.

subprojects.name: Portfolio
subprojects.fcc_style_description: This is the final required project to earn the certification, meaning the layout of the project is entirely up to the developer. The original course involves building a personal portfolio page.
subprojects.my_style_description: The last project is based on the development of a personal portfolio, similar to the current project but much simpler, since it is developed only with HTML, CSS, and JS, unlike this one that has a backend. The project includes the main projects as an interactive map.

projects.title: Playground
projects.description: The first group of applications I developed using JavaScript is called that way because it consists of 3 very basic games. The first one is creating a birthday card, the second is a memory game, and the third is adopting a random fish.

projects.title: LPS Catalogue
projects.description: I used an old toy collection as an excuse to develop an inventory. As a collector of various objects, creating catalogue-type pages is one of the things I enjoy doing the most because it involves storing and filtering large amounts of data, as well as exposing it in a harmonious way. I took advantage of the excess information to create a questionnaire about the inventory information.

projects.title: Majesties
projects.description: The objective of this project is to compare the outcome of the original exercise provided by fCC (fCC style) and my personal approach based on this original exercise (My Style).

projects.title: Portfolio
projects.description: One of the most important aspects that I try to reflect in the content of my current project is the way I think and diagram. I enjoy developing dynamic content the most, where small details make the user more immersed in the webpage, responding to a reality that demands constantly updated content.

projects.title: Echinoderm Buildings
projects.description: Echinoderm Buildings reflects the transgression of buildings into transmuted structures. Sets of buildings and marine species are trained and the result of the merge, 'transmuted species', are evaluated by a python classifier. Will the monstrous transcanon trick the discriminator and conceive the Echinoderm Buildings as architecture?

projects.title: Orbzidyum
projects.description: Orbzidyum is a dark-adventure game where the character seeks to restore the ecosystems within the shell its trapped in. Each ecosystem holds a variety of species that can whether be killed or befriended, decisions that will forge a character and have an impact on future games to come. Orbzidyum is just the birth of Bridyam, world full of dark yet beautiful secrets.
